website_summaries.verdict: Take your tennis balls with you anywhere easily with this wheeled cart. Heavy-duty construction materials.
pros: No wires to rust, thanks to polypropylene construction
Handle can lock in the up position for transporting the cart or for collecting balls
Handles can lock into down position to serve as legs for ball retrieval
Secure lid keeps balls from falling out during transport
cons: Can be difficult to assemble the basket properly
Wheels may wear out after frequent use

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, sturdy enough for typical use.
customer_reviews.text: Simple product that just works well. - The long metal handles are sturdy enough as stands. - The adjustable bars at the top keep the balls in during transport allowing me to lay it flat in the car trunk. The handle is fairly long so it might be tight for a small sedan trunk. Shouldn't be a problem for a bigger sedan or an SUV. - The rollers make it easy to move around while picking up the balls or between car and court. It may not seem like a big deal, but it is just so much move convenient having the rollers there.
customer_reviews.author: Hoei L

customer_reviews.title: Durable and wheeled!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best ball hoppers for recreational players. Well- thought out design and very durable. I am not handy, but the hopper was super easy to assemble, especially after reading in the comments that I should attach the wheels before putting the walls of the hopper together. I love that it has wheels and rolls! If you're deciding between the versions with wheels and without, get the wheeled one. Your shoulder, back, and hands will thank you! Mine have for the 2+ years I've owned this hopper.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but note a durability issue
customer_reviews.text: The designers made a small mistake on the fasteners. Hard plastic doesn't hold a screw well, especially when the normal use of the product includes repeated torque, in this case side-to-side stress. So the screws fall out, usually on the tennis court, where you usually lose them. And they are difficult to replace with a bolt/nut because the slot is constricted. I have never used the wheels, which seems a little silly given the weight of tennis balls, but were I walking some distance to the court, I might consider this a good feature.
customer_reviews.author: Lake Gregory

customer_reviews.title: This has to be the best tennis ballport so far I've seen
customer_reviews.text: This has to be the best tennis ballport so far I've seen, well designed overall. It doesn't come with step-by-step instructions, since its straightforward 15min setup to me at least and if you've never put an IKEA before then you may find it challenging. As others said, screw in the [optional] wheels first, then other's will fall in its place and use the original box picture as a guide for efficient installation. When season over, i've the option to unscrew few to fold it up, if needed but may never do so since its plastic and light weight to store anywhere. It is a must-buy for tennis jocks or for a efficient player. I tested it and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: 007KoP

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: What kind of ball hopper needs 20 screws, 16 washers, and 16 nuts to put together? This one! To make matters worse, the assembly instructions are terrible. Not only was this overly Complicated to assemble, it’s heavy and I really doubt it will last more than a few useless due to all the plastic pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Soapface

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product

customer_reviews.title: Ballport Ball Carrier is Not Safe
customer_reviews.text: This ball carrier is not safe, my husband received four stitches in his big toe. When this is stood up it is not stable. The handles become the legs when stood upright. However, the molded plastic supports on the side of Ballport do NOT safely latch the metal legs. The edges of the plastic on the bottom of the Ballport are quite sharp, the carrier collapsed (gave no warning or sound) and my husband ended up in urgent care. We purchased this because the unit was plastic and had wheels, we ended up with four stitches because the latch on the side of the carrier is not adequate to hold the legs in place.

Great basket, sturdy, convenient, much more stable than metal hoppers. Fits a lot of balls.

product_meta.title: Tourna Ballport Deluxe Tennis Ball Hopper with Wheels - Holds 80 Balls
product_meta.description: Balloon port 80 deluxe holds 80 balls and comes with wheels for easy Maneuverability. The handles are an extra long 33 inch for more convenient feed and pickup. Very lightweight yet durable makes this one of the most premium hoppers on the market. Loaded with patented features: legs lock in up and down position. Bars at the top slide closed so your the balls don't fall out during transport. Bars roll at the bottom so the ball slips in the hopper easily.
feature_bullets: WHEELS make it extra easy to maneuver for people of all ages

LIGHTWEIGHT and DURABLE: Weighs only 4.5 lbs. Up to 50% less weight than other hoppers of similar capacity. Made of heavy duty double re-enforced polypropylene. No wires to rust, paint to peel, or welds to break

LOCKING HANDLES: Patented handles lock in both the up and down position. No more legs flying out from underneath the basket spilling balls. Legs are secured in with a mount so the legs will never fall out
EASY PICKUP: Patented bars roll at the bottom to make it easy to lift balls into the basket, even when the basket gets full
SECURE TRANSPORT: Sliding bars close at the top provide a quick and secure closure
HIGH PROFILE: Stands 33.5-inches high for convenient ball feeding
PRO ENDORSERS: Endorsed by Pete Sampras and the Bryan Brothers. Quick Assembly
